item.title: Understanding the Constitution of Knowledge
item.description:
Understanding the “Constitution of Knowledge” by Jonathan Rauch

In Jonathan Rauch’s book, The Constitution of Knowledge: A Defense of Truth, he provides a compelling analysis of how societies can establish and sustain truth. Epistemic chaos, a central concern of the book, refers to a breakdown in shared understanding and agreement about what constitutes knowledge and truth. It occurs when misinformation and disinformation undermine trust in traditional sources of authority and expertise, leaving individuals and communities struggling to distinguish fact from fiction. This challenge is particularly pressing in an era of rampant misinformation and polarization.
